noun.description: The European storm petrel, Hydrobates pelagicus. Chiefly recorded in dictionaries.

origin: Late 18th century; earliest use found in George Low (1747–1795), naturalist. Probably from a first element of Norn origin (perhaps meaning squirting out, belching out) + 19th-cent. Shetland Scots mutti small thing, also storm petrel.
